verbose_text: One possibility is that in unloaded cells treated with IL-1beta, HDAC6 activity is reduced to such an extent that further suppression by tubacin causes a compensatory upregulation of the deacetylase, sirt-2 which blocks IL-1beta-induced tubulin acetylation which has previously been reported in neurons XREF_BIBR.
evidence: HDAC6 activity is reduced to such an extent that further suppression by tubacin causes a compensatory upregulation of the deacetylase, sirt-2 which blocks IL-1beta-induced tubulin acetylation
